DOC.brief_summary: This study follow 40 healthy , vaginally deliver infant primarily ( > /- 75 % ) breast feed 40 infant exclusively formula feed least first 4 month life birth 12 month age . Visits - Subjects consent prior delivery , visit 1 . Subject see possible delivery instruction stool collection distribution supply , visit 2 . Subject see 6 month age post immunization , visit 3 . Subject see prior 12 month visit . Study staff contact via phone/email collect information feeding change .
DOC.brief_title: Infant Immunity Comparison Breastfed Bottlefed Infants
DOC.detailed_description: Cord Blood collect birth possible peripheral blood collect 6 month age ( 5 10 day receive standard 6 month immunization ) 12 month age prior 12 month immunization . Additionally , stool sample collect within first week live monthly 12 month age . Breastfeeding mother collect breast milk monthly time stool specimen period breastfeeding .
DOC.criteria: Selfdeclared pregnant woman Age 18 year old time consent Willing able sign consent follow study schedule Planned vaginal delivery Willing primarily breastfed formula feed first four month Planned delivery CSection Unwillingness exclusively breast feed formula fee infant least first 4 month Unwillingness receive standard immunization schedule recommend American Academy Pediatrics Chronic maternal condition may influence infant immunity include limited : maternal HIV , immunodeficiency , use immunosuppressive medication , malignancy autoimmunity Known fetal medical condition congenital malformation Use immune modulating/immune suppressive medication prophylactic antibiotic pregnancy Any condition may prevent mother plan breast feed breast feed Any condition opinion investigator would interfere conduct study
